intro: Barnettia kerrii, commonly known as the Kerri's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is known for its delicate, herbaceous appearance. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Barnettia kerrii is considered a rare and endangered species.
